definition[0]: to be lying on your back – used to emphasize that someone seems unlikely to get up soon
example[0]: He was drunk and flat on his back on the street.
definition[1]: to be so ill that you cannot get out of bed
example[1]: Their best player was flat on his back in hospital.
definition[2]: if a business, country, economy etc is on its back, it is not successful
example[2]: The UK market was flat on its back.
definition[3]: to be lying down so that all of your back is touching the floor
definition[4]: to be very ill so that you have to stay in bed for a period of time
example[3]: I’ve been flat on my back with the flu all week.
